results.description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server

results.description: This admission controller rejects all net-new usage of the Service field externalIPs
results.name: Ensure that the --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set

results.description: Use https for kubelet connections
results.name: Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true

results.description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication
results.name: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate

results.description: Verify kubelets certificate before establishing connection
results.name: Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate

results.description: Do not always authorize all requests
results.name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow

results.description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them
results.name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node

results.description: Turn on Role Based Access Control
results.name: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC

results.description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set

results.description: Do not allow all requests

results.description: Always pull images
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set

results.description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used

results.description: Automate service accounts management
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set

results.description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set

results.description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify
results.name: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set

results.description: Do not disable the secure port
results.name: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0

results.name: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false

results.description: Kubernetes provides the option to use client certificates for user authentication. However as there is no way to revoke these certificates when a user leaves an organization or loses their credential, they are not suitable for this purpose
results.name: Client certificate authentication should not be used for users (Manual)

results.name: Ensure that the audit policy covers key security concerns (Manual)

results.description: The Kubernetes API stores secrets, which may be service account tokens for the Kubernetes API or credentials used by workloads in the cluster
results.name: Minimize access to secrets

results.description: Kubernetes Roles and ClusterRoles provide access to resources based on sets of objects and actions that can be taken on those objects. It is possible to set either of these to be the wildcard "*" which matches all items
results.name: Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles

results.description: Service accounts tokens should not be mounted in pods except where the workload running in the pod explicitly needs to communicate with the API server
results.name: Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary

results.description: Cluster roles and roles with the impersonate, bind or escalate permissions should not be granted unless strictly required
results.name: Limit use of the Bind, Impersonate and Escalate permissions in the Kubernetes cluster
